job description:
Title: Marketing and Data Analyst

Location: M&T Center, Buffalo NY

Function:

Responsible for providing complex, non-routine analytical, technical and operational support at the business or department level. May act as project leader on less complex but highly visible projects.

Position Responsibilities:

The position is responsible for support in a variety of functions to include but not limited to the following:

Reporting
  • Quarterly prospect meeting (e.g. manage meeting, communications and prospect database)
  • Pipeline reporting (e.g. ERM sales opportunities via Tableau)
  • Key lead reporting for Business Partners
  • Preparation of periodic and ad hoc reporting requested by the Area Executive or Regional President
  • Weekly Market Update Reporting
  • Monthly projected new loan closing/payoff reporting for Finance
  • Work with Commercial Marketing, Finance, etc. on the preparation of Board and/or Management Group presentations
  • Market disruption tracking and reporting
  • Quarterly Department Newsletter (e.g. outlining personal and professional achievements)
Marketing
  • Prepare and disseminate marketing materials to customers and prospects (e.g. thought leadership)
  • Prepare marketing materials for distribution on customer/prospect calls
  • Utilize SAVO to prepare ad hoc presentations for customer/prospect calls
  • Utilize social media to promote employees of Department and Bank in general (e.g. 40 Under 40)
  • Collaborates with compliance when preparing any new external communications
Event Planning
  • Create and maintain upcoming event list. Assigns table captains and performs necessary follow-up
  • Department event management. Management of event from start to finish. Responsibilities will include confirming contact information, sending invitations, tracking responses, perform necessary follow-up, etc.
  • Schedule Business Partner department training
  • Collaboration with other departments of the Bank when planning events with a broader scope of guests
  • COI event management. Need an organized strategy for maintaining relationships with COI
Research
  • Perform industry/market research as requested
  • Disseminate pertinent news related to customers/prospects on a timely basis
Department Liaison
  • HR New employee onboarding
  • IT (e.g. computers, SARs
  • Facilities Department
Minimum Qualifications Required:
  • Bachelor's degree in an applicable field (i.e. Business, Finance, Statistics, Marketing, MIS) or the equivalent in work experience.
  • Five to seven years' experience in field.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Strong analytical ability and creative problem solving skills
  • Ability to multitask, is organized and detail oriented
  • Ability to interact with all levels of personnel (e.g. Area Executive, Regional President)
  • Detail oriented
  • Self-starter
Ideal Qualifications Preferred:
  • One to two years of relevant work experience, preferably in the financial services experience.
  • Two years' prior departmental experience.
  • Proficient in the use of spreadsheet (Excel), database management, presentation, and department specific software (ERM, CLAS, the HUB, etc.)
